comment.author: 42549095@N00
comment._content: Great Picture. Good to see it hasn't changed much!

comment.author: 64848937@N00
comment._content: Golden eagles once nested on the crag and the last pair were shot in the years up to 1918.  Today the site is part of the Killarney National Park and a wilderness nature reserve.  The Rangers hope to re-introduce the eagle to the site and have made great strides in restoring the landscape which has been attacked by Rhododendron ponticum which had been introduced as a garden plant but escaped.  I have sat on this mountain many times and watch the clouds scud by and fish jump in the lake.
